text: is a Japanese professional football clubJsoccer.com, "Japan J.League Teams" ; retrieved 2012-7-5. in the Urawa wardThe team's hometown is the city of Saitama in Saitama Prefecture, but its name comes from the former city of Urawa, which is now a ward of the prefectural capital city. of Saitama.Soccerway.com, "Urawa Red Diamonds"; retrieved 2012-3-2. In 2007, the Urawa Reds were the first Japanese team to reach the finals of the Asian Champions League. "Urawa Reds advances to final," New York Times. October 24, 2007; retrieved 2012-3-26. Its famous in Japan developing young good players. ==History== The club was founded in 1950. * 1950-1992 Mitsubishi Motors SC * 1992-present Urawa Red Diamonds == League title == * Japan Soccer League Division 1 : 4 ** 1969, 1973, 1978, 1982 * Japan Soccer League Division 2 : 1 ** 1989/90 * J1 League : 1 ** 2006 == League position == *2011 : J1 League - 15th *2012 : J1 League - 3rd *2013 : J1 League - 6th *2014 : J1 League - 2nd *2015 : J1 League - 3rd *2016 : J1 League - 2nd *2017 : J1 League - 7th *2018 : J1 League - 5th *2019 : J1 League - 14th *2020 : J1 League - 10th === Former position === == Notable achievements == In 2009, Edmilson (Edmilson Dos Santos Silva) made three goals in one game (hat-trick) against Jubilo Iwata.WorldFootball.net, "3 Goals in one game"; retrieved 2012-7-5. ==Related pages == * Sports in Japan * List of Japanese football teams * List of Urawa Red Diamonds players == References == ==Other websites== * Urawa Red Diamonds website ; * J.League Club Guide Category:Football clubs in Saitama Prefecture
title: Urawa Red Diamonds
